description: From Old French contumelieus, from Latin contumēliōsus (“insulting; abusive”), from contumēlia (“affront, abuse, insult”).

adjectives.description: contumelious (comparative more contumelious, superlative most contumelious)

entries.meaning: (archaic, literary) Rudely contemptuous; showing contumely; exhibiting an insolent or disdainful attitude.
